New Records: First men's team to hold both 20-over and 50-over titles at the same time
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes hit an unbeaten fifty in the final
Adil Rashid slowed down the game perfectly
Sam Curran took 3-12 in the final
Post-Match Reflections: England's Chris Woakes: 'We have lost a lot of games in Australia but to win here at the MCG is amazing.'

England all-rounder Moeen Ali: 'This is one of the best days of my career. We deserved it over a long period of time, we've played some amazing cricket but fell short in the semis last year. Now we have done it against an amazing Pakistan side in front of all these fans.'
England opener Alex Hales: 'I definitely didn't think playing for England would come around again. The last 6-8 weeks have been so enjoyable and this is the icing on the cake.'
Harry Brook: 'So good. A lot of people would not expect to win a World Cup at 23 but being in this squad I always thought we would win it. We showed the world how good we are.'
England coach Matthew Mott: 'We did it the hard way. The boys held their nerve and got a great result.'
Ben Stokes: 'I didn't really take in the fact that we were the first men's team to hold both trophies till you really said it. It just shows where we are as a team.'
Jos Buttler: 'He is the ultimate competitor in anything he does. He has a hell of a lot of experience now as well. He can take a lot on his shoulders.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: England beat Pakistan by five wickets to claim second T20 world title

Ravi Bopara: 'One of the great things to come from this World Cup is the teams we thought were the lesser teams, we've seen how much they've improved. The likes of Ireland and Zimbabwe have caught up - I just want to say a massive well done to them.'
Ravi Bopara: 'The upsets that have been involved have been brilliant and it has kept everybody on their toes.'
Ravi Bopara: 'There was never a stage where the group was finalised and that is a great place to be in a World Cup.'
Others: England's Sam Curran was named Player of the Match and Player of the Tournament
